This is maybe a bit far fetched, but I'll have a go anyway: What if each project information page had some feature where one could add one or more screenshots which would be collected and presented on the screenshots page? Here's what I'm thinking...
Building a screenshots page is not all that hard. Maintaining it (i.e. keeping it up-to-date) is the hard part.
As part of the new Project Management Infrastructure (Bug 363868) we're providing a means of consistently capturing information about individual project releases. I propose that we extend this implementation to associate a handful of screenshots with a release.
With that information in place, we can generate a script that pulls screenshots from the latest releases of each project.
Any project that wants their project represented on a "screenshots" page need only ensure the screenshots associated with their most current release be up-to-date. They can even specify screenshots for future releases that will automatically be adopted when a future release becomes the current release.
There's a little more discussion of this on Bug 363524

> Any project that wants their project represented on a "screenshots" page need > only ensure the screenshots associated with their most current release be > up-to-date.
